description:
Runs amazingly, looks gorgeous and works in Gaming Mode too.

Only issue is I can't find the non-root directory version of the .cfg file, and have been unable to add my own mods.
I love the OpenMW engine! It runs so smoothly and brings back so many great memories. I'm very grateful to the OpenMW Team for what they have done and I honestly can't wait for the 1.0 release.
summary: Wake up ... I heard them say we've reached Morrowind ..

description: I've put dozens of hours into this (and Morrowind) so far without experiencing any bugs. I suspect that this is now the best way to experience what may be the greatest game ever made.
and no crashing
Telvanni approved
What's not to like?
summary: Robust, Inclusive, No-Nonsense GUI to Play Morrowind on Linux

description: Very good, want those for Oblivion and Skyrim

OpenMW is the king/queen when it comes to playing Morrowind in the modern day. Not only is it the best choice for Linux, but arguably even for Windows too. You will currently lose access to some mods, but I think you'd be surprised how many work with it. Remember, it's an entire new engine for Morrowind, and it's widely accepted too.
summary: Popular, long standing Morrowind engine replacement!

description: Best option to emulate Morrowind on Linux
Download it you N'wah!
summary: Best way to play morrowind nowadays!

description:
Currently using the most recent nightlies for the shadow updates, plus some interesting water effects. Version 0.45 is still amazing though. No slowdowns like on my old Xbox. Can't wait for the construction set to be fully developed! 

0.45 runs great on a i5-7300u /w integrated graphics and 8GB RAM @ 2560x1080. With shadows, 0.46, 50-60FPS is attainable with my 3800X w/ RTX 2070 and 16GB RAM, also @2560x1080.
I love the elder scrolls
thx man good job

An incredible project breathing life back into a timeless masterpiece. Now you can experience this wonderful game on a variety of platforms including GNU/Linux and without dealing with emulation or many of the limitations of the original engine. Of course, you need the original game CDs/files to play, but it's not expensive or difficult to obtain them.

Some advice:

If you're using the gog exe version, you can use innoextract to avoid the hassle of installing the game via Wine:

- open your terminal
- sudo apt-get install innoextract
- open terminal in the folder where you put the Morrowind gog exe file
- innoextract Morrowind.exe (or whatever the file is called)
- Now, open OpenMW to the wizard and point it to an "existing installation" and set the path to the files you extracted

Enjoy :-)

I've been following the project since 2019. The engine replacement has reached the point that it has completely surpassed the original Morrowind game! The latest release with this writing is .47, and I recomend everyone to get the game and its dependencies from openmw's official website. No more waiting for 1.0, its been here since the last release!
summary: The only way to play Morrowind

description: It crashes. I think you should upload the up-to-date version, please.
summary: I would give it 5 stars, but

description: I'm new to Linux and Morrowind but I've been a follower of RPG type games for years. This one takes me back so I thought I would see if this software enables me to play an old Windows XP game on a Ubuntu platform. Well it certainly works well..! Just write down or remember the installation paths as you might be asked the location of certain files but apart from that it was easy to do. I'd like to see more old Windows games brought back to life in this way. Nicely done!

Works great, I purchased Morrowind from Steam, then used this to run it because it works so much better on big screens.

However, don't use the Ubuntu repo, at least not the 20.04 one - it makes the game crash when saving. Install from the ppa at https://launchpad.net/~openmw/+archive/ubuntu/openmw to get the current, and working, version.

Morrowind is my favorite game ever, so it's nice to see a dedicate effort to not only reimplement it in a cross-platform way (barely legally distinguished from a port for legal reasons) and even improve the shading and modding engines.

easy to install
easy to mod
runs better
multiplatform

I tried using the other method of getting Open MW to run on Steam Deck but it never worked right. This one works like a charm, no headaches. Only downside is my gameplay hours arent being tracked but no biggie, already missing hundreds from the CD version.
No way to remove mods. They stay in the data files tab forever, even after uninstalling and reinstalling.

If you uninstall this version it will delete all of your save games

This may happen when you upgrade too

Dozens of hours down the drain. Complete waste of time
One of the best Elder Scrolls game in the series, just look up "How To Morrowind" on YouTUbe and that's all you need to get started.

This version is still at 0.47 while the latest has modding support that would help a lot on Steam Deck, given that we don't have Vortex or anythingand I'm not clever enough to figure out other managers
if you try to use the setup wizard to find your esm files it just freezes openmw its not possible to fix right now only way to use openmw is usining luxtorpeda
Would like to be able to use 0.48

Eveyone complaining about not being on 0.48.0, this is the stable release, 0.48.0 & modding is beta release (as of 19/06/23). To install beta, run the following in the terminal
flatpak install flathub-beta org.openmw.OpenMW

OpenMW is awesome & this flatpak works great.

OpenMW has just released v0.48 via their Launchpad PPA. Copy and paste this link to get it: https://launchpad.net/~openmw/+archive/ubuntu/openmw

It's not the flatpak, but you'll figure it out.
Finally LUA Mods !
I cant think of a single time this has crashed on me in 2 years.
Works great with no bugs, even with mods.
It works great on gaming mode. But on desktop mode the controlls are backwards and I can't fix it no matter what I try, I never had this issue until now.
This whole project has been an interesting journey and it's still going on, if you wanna play Morrowind, especially with mods, this is the way to go.
vvvvvbvgyjfhdcbrsewa
Being able to play such a groundbreaking RPG as Morrowind, natively on Linux, is a gift.

Although missing some pretty vital mod compatibility (MGE and MGSE especially), this works well, and it's less buggy than the actual Gambryo engine it's been taken from. Also, if you're giving this thing a low rating because you need the original files to play, you really need to read the full description before you install software.
summary: Works perfectly, but needs better mod compatibility

Xonotic es un videojuego de disparos en primera persona. Es software libre. Fue desarrollado como un fork de Nexuiz, luego de la controversia generada por la diferencia de puntos de vista por el desarrollo del videojuego anterior. Wikipedia
Fecha de estreno inicial: 8 de septiembre de 2011
Motor: Quake engine
Modo: Videojuego multijugador
Género: Videojuego de disparos en primera persona
Modos de juego: Un jugador, multijugador
Plataformas: Microsoft Windows, GNU/Linux, macOS, FreeBSD
